main event: On 29 Aug 1949, a farmer in Maplewood, Ohio, witnessed a large, silver-colored sphere that seemed to arise from behind a woods, float across his farm, and disintegrate in mid-air while unraveling a silvery substance.
interesting points: The object was observed at 5:30 AM and was described as large and silver in color.
It seemed to disintegrate in mid-air while unraveling a silvery substance and was witnessed by a sincere and conscientious farmer.
There is no astronomical explanation for the incident, and it is suggested that it could have been a weather balloon in the process of disintegration.
The investigations considered wind direction and speed, as well as the location of the nearest weather station making balloon observations.
The incident report was part of Project 'SIGN', responsible for collecting data on unidentified flying objects and determining their nature.
sighted object: large, silver-colored sphere with a disintegrating silvery substance
